text: Yet another example of the instant Twitter stupidity that goes viral and infects the media's ability to think independently. No context, no common sense, everything reduced to a bludgeon.
author: joehagansays

text: It came from both the far left and the far right, equally toxic, and equally stupid. But it was those extremes that defined the coverage on cable TV.
author: joehagansays

text: The question becomes: Is that level of snark & meanness necessary to vet an opponent, or is it exactly what will destroy the Democrats chances for beating Trump?
author: joehagansays

text: But then came a lemming-like rush to bludgeon him with a single misinterpreted sentence. The simultaneous brutality and inaccuracy of it were Trump like.  The political press has been staring at Trump for so long that it's become like him, adopted his cynicism & meanness.
author: joehagansays

text: Case in point was the interpretation of the Beto quote saying he was "born to be in it" as some kind of manifest destiny. He was obviously just expressing enthusiasm for running.
author: joehagansays

text: I think it partially explains the acid reception that Beto got last week. It showed the degree to which the press has been infected by Donald Trump's Twitter.
